subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Wednesday, 25 April, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Live - Chelsea v Liverpool
Chelsea host Liverpool in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final.



 
World Cup winner Ball dies at 61
England World Cup winner Alan Ball has died of a heart attack at the age of 61.



 
Roma & Man Utd fined over trouble
Roma and Man Utd are fined after crowd trouble at the Champions League quarter-final first leg tie at the Stadio Olimpico.








GOLF




Woods expects tough US Open test
Tiger Woods says the Oakmont course at this year's US Open will be a harder test than the recent Masters at Augusta.



 
Mickelson signs up coach Harmon
Phil Mickelson turns to swing coach Butch Harmon in a bid to improve the accuracy of his long game.



 
Muirfield seniors bow for Faldo
Nick Faldo will return to the scene of his 1987 and 1992 Open wins for his Seniors Tour debut in July.








MOTORSPORT




Raikkonen urged to get technical
Kimi Raikkonen's former team boss hints the Finn could be even better if he paid more attention to his role outside the car.



 
Pedrosa should be ready for China
Honda's Dani Pedrosa should be able to ride in the Chinese MotoGP despite crashing out in Turkey last weekend.



 
Turkey to keep F1 race until 2021
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone guarantees the future of the Turkish Grand Prix for at least the next 15 years.








FORMULA ONE




Raikkonen urged to get technical
Kimi Raikkonen's former team boss hints the Finn could be even better if he paid more attention to his role outside the car.



 
Turkey to keep F1 race until 2021
Formula One supremo Bernie Ecclestone guarantees the future of the Turkish Grand Prix for at least the next 15 years.



 
BMW may offer Heidfeld new deal
Nick Heidfeld's impressive start to the season could go a long way to landing a new deal with BMW Sauber.








ATHLETICS




Radcliffe not in GB marathon team
GB's marathon team for the World Athletics Championships is named but does not include Paula Radcliffe at this stage.



 
Yamauchi voices Osaka heat fears
Mara Yamauchi warns conditions in Osaka at the World Athletics Championships will be even tougher than during the London Marathon.



 
Runner dies after London Marathon
A 22-year-old runner who was taken ill after completing the London Marathon dies in hospital.








CYCLING




Cooke misses out on Belgian win
Nicole Cooke loses out to main rival Marianne Vos in the Belgian stage of the World Cup, the Fleche Wallonne.



 
Tour of Britain route is revealed
Organisers unveil the route for this year's Tour of Britain, which will begin in London on Sunday, 9 September.



 
Hoy to help with Velopark design
Olympic champion Chris Hoy will sit on the panel choosing the design for the Velopark cycling venue at the London 2012 Games.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Rafa Benitez on his Scouse daughter, plus Mick McCarthy and St Albans chant



 
Chris Evans talks to Steve Thompson
England Rugby World Cup  winner Steve Thompson talks to Chris Evans about his binges on beer and takeaways since retirement. Chris and sidekick Jonny Saunders have a different sporting guest every evening on their Radio 2 show.



 
Wednesday's gossip column
Claudio Ranieri is linked to Fulham, plus other rumours
